content.description:
Climb the arete right of

Kublai Khan

, left of

Johler Coaster

.  The crux is at the overhung bottom.
content.protection:
Top rope.  Can use the bolts from

Genghis Khan

.
content.location:
This is right of

Genghis Khan

and left of

Johler Coaster

.

content.description:
Thickly Settled climbs the face to the right of "

Conspicuous Consumption

". Climb pebbles until you reach the small overhang (crux), step over it, and continue up the slab on small holds.
content.protection:
Two bolts on top of "

Conspicuous Consumption

."

content.description:
This is an easy little corner, much like the ladder. You can use the anchors to top rope from any of the nearby Khan climbs or

Clive

.
content.protection: Top rope.
content.location:
This lies between

Clive

and

Kublai Khan

.

content.description:
Start at the base of

Coroner's Crack

, but take the right hand crack system, topping out to the right.

This is a great route for beginner trad climbers.  It is a fun climb with large, obvious, easy to place pro from good solid rests.  The crux is in the middle section and is initially puzzly for its grade, thus the (+).  Watch for some of the ever-present cactus on the top.

I'm sure we're not the real FA, but this route is not named in Hanson's '99 revision guide.
content.protection: Mostly larger pieces.  I used hexes & a 2.5 tri-cam.
content.location:
This uses the same start as

Coroner's Crack

, left of the Labor Day/

Jerry's Kids

face.

content.description:
Spring and Fall is to the right of

Equinox

. Look for two vertical cracks which start about 15 feet up, and head for them. The crux is at the two cracks.
content.protection:
This shares the same two bolts with

Equinox

.

content.description:
This route is on the face to the right of "

Elf Jism Dihedral

". Start where there is a small shrub at the base of the wall. Head up towards the scooped out ledge. Then follow a thin angling lip, to a final lunge towards a jug. Watch for cactus on top.
content.protection: Natural anchors. There is a crack on top, bring a #3 and a #4. You can also thread a chockstone about 20 feet back behind the huge block. Again watch for cactus. This route becomes a 10+ when your hand is loaded with quills (learned from experience)!
content.location: Downclimb on easy 3rd class to the south. Or circle around the point, and find a downclimb there.

content.description:
Climb the face to the right of

Cooking with Crash

. The action doesn't begin until your ten feet up.   It has thin crimps to the top.
content.protection: No anchors. Bring a 30 foot runner to sling a boulder. A #3 Cam can be placed in the corner to back up runners.
content.location:
This is the face to the right of

Cooking with Crash

. Scramble down to the north, hike back around the point.

content.description: Climb up the ledge system under the roof, and aim for the crack(s) towards the left. Climb up the cracks, and pass the bush to a ledge. From the ledge, you finish up the crack (crux).
content.protection: A standard rack and slings.

content.description:
Kublai Khan is around the corner to the left of "

Elf Jism Dihedral

." Climb to the right of the bolts. There are three small ledges on the climb, the crux is getting a hand on the first ledge. Once you get a hand on it, traverse left for the clip. If you go higher, it's harder to clip. Enjoy the next big reaches to the other two ledges.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description:
"Johler Coaster" is the corner crack to the left of "

Elf Jism Dihedral

". Climb up an overhanging face on big holds to the start of the crack. Follow the crack to the top.
content.protection:
Takes nuts, and small cams #0.3-0.75. A #3 would be good at the start.

Top-rope - no anchors, just sling a boulder directly above it. Watch out for cactus on top.

content.description:
This climbs the face just right of the large, inside corner right of

Conspicuous Consumption

.  A few thin moves get you going to some nice pockets and edges.  The right edge of the arete is off.  After a good rest in a large pocket, make some straightforward moves for the rest of the route.  The crux is at the first bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2-bolt anchor.

content.description:
Climb the face to the right of

April Fool

. It has nice edges, try not to use the ledge to the left.
content.protection:
No anchors. Bring a 30 foot runner to sling a boulder, back it up with a bolt from

Jerry's Kids

.

April Fool

, Ian, and

Cooking with Crash

can all use the same setup.
content.location:
This is the face to the right of

April Fool

. Scramble down to the north hike back around the point.

content.description:
This goes directly up the bolted line between

Wrath of Khan

on the right, and

Clive

on the face to the left of the corner.
content.protection: Three bolts and the anchor.

content.description: An overhanging crumbling start eases off to some solid rock. Enjoy the juggy middle section, but be cautious of one loose cobble. Finish with a fun mantle. If you want to avoid the unpleasant start, just climb the ledge to the right, and swing over.
content.protection: Two anchors up top.

content.description: This is an interesting route with a one or two move crux.  The first bolt is 15 feet off the deck, but after that the bolts are very well-placed.  Stem up the dihedral using the thin crack and pockets on the West-facing wall to get you to a good stance below the final overhang.  The key to this section is getting your feet high and stemming.  Once you make the crux move, you can reach the anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts to 2 cold shuts.

content.description:
This ascends the arete on the left side of

Clive

.  A shallow dihedral (a foot or so) is at the bottom of the arete - it is hard to miss!  Per the guide, stay slightly right of the corner.  It's true.
content.protection: TR.
content.location:
This is the arete on the left side of

Clive

.

content.description:
Coroner's Crack is the small roof crack in between "

The Ladder

" and "

Jerry's Kids

". If you enjoy leading on rodent urine-soaked rock with the occasional pocket-o-poo, this is the climb for you. Once you reach the roof (crux), prepare for an arm bar in the crack with loose, flaky feet below. There are some big jugs on top to pull through the loose stuff.
content.protection: Cams - 0.5 to 2. A #5 cam is key to protecting the finish of the climb.

content.description:
Climb the corner to the right of

Ian

. It has good edges for stemming.
content.protection:
No anchors. Bring a 30 foot runner to sling a boulder, back it up with a bolt from

Jerry's Kids

.

April Fool

,

Ian

, and Cooking with Crash can all use the same setup.
content.location:
This is the corner to the right of

Ian

. Scramble down to the North. Then hike back around the point.

content.description: This is a pretty good lead up a thin crack for 40 feet.  Start in the small, left-facing dihedral just left of a roof and a large, left-facing, inside corner.  Jam and stem your way up to some good ledges.  The pro is decent but a little unnerving when you're making moves over a no. 2 RP in sandy rock....  Continue up the finger crack to a large ledge, then stem up a right-facing dihedral to the bolts.
content.protection: This has somewhat marginal pro in spots, because the rock isn't very solid.  Full set of RPs, some Aliens, TCUs, micro cams or the like.  Rack up to a #1 Friend.  A #3 Friend is useful for the last short section.  There are two bolts on top of the wall.

content.description:
Thin moves up the face and balancy moves to the next rest.  It is pretty technical and sequential for 5.8.  Moving right past the second bolt is 5.9, while left of the bolt is 5.8.  It is not a bad warmup.

Note: The FFA (sport lead) was by Darrin Stein on 7-4-94 and is AKA Born on the 4th of July.
content.protection: Three bolts to 2 cold shuts.

content.description:
Autumnal Wall is a few feet to the right of "

Spring and Fall

". Look for a small crack about twenty feet up, and follow the face up to, and through it. It eases off after the crack.  You can use the bolts for "

Conspicuous Consumption

", but prepare for a pendulum if you come off.
content.protection:
Two bolts above "

Conspicuous Consumption

". Prepare for a pendulum if you come off.

content.description:
Climb the arete to the right of

Jerry's Kids

. The crux is in the middle, climbing out of the dished out corner.
content.protection:
No anchors. Bring a 30 foot runner to sling a boulder, back it up with a bolt from

Jerry's Kids

. April Fools,

Ian

, and

Cooking with Crash

can all use the same setup.
content.location:
This is the arete to the right of

Jerry's Kids

. Scramble north to get down.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
